Dialogue.NPCText:
You behold Master Corvus Deyne—tall, hawk-eyed, and draped in a swirling azure mantle. His gaze is like cold lightning.

"Well, well... a groundling dares the heights of Aerilon. I am Master Corvus Deyne, the Conclave's war-bringer, though lesser minds might call me 'reckless.' Tell me, do you seek wisdom, power, or merely a place to be useful?"
His staff crackles faintly with pent-up energy.
"Choose your words. I abhor wasting time."

Option.text: I want to prove my worth to Aerilon.
What exactly do you do for the Conclave?
What do you think of Selara Vael’s leadership?
You seem tense. What troubles you?
You speak like someone who’s seen more than war. What shaped you?
I have no business with you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Corvus’s eyes narrow, assessing you.

"You have ambition. Good. Most in this city lack the spine to act, content to bask in Selara’s radiance or dither with their crystal calculations."
He leans in, voice low and conspiratorial.
"Aerilon thrives not by standing still, but by acting boldly. There are tasks for those who seek to rise—dangerous tasks, requiring discretion and nerve. Would you carry out a delivery on the Conclave’s behalf?"

Option.text: Name the task, and I’ll see it done.
Depends who I’m delivering to.
I serve only the city, not your schemes.
No thanks.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Corvus produces a small, rune-etched reliquary. Frosty vapors seep from its seams.

"This is a Phylactery of Shattered Fates, its contents... sensitive. I need it delivered to a scholar outside Aerilon—one with the 'Skeletal Cat Scholar' trait. They possess knowledge Selara and her ilk would bury in archives. Time is short, and discretion is paramount."
He fixes you with an electric stare.
"Do this, and I will see your name sung in the halls of power. Fail, and I shall forget you ever existed."

Option.text: I accept. Where do I find this Skeletal Cat Scholar?
A phylactery? Are you trafficking with necromancers?
What if Selara finds out?
I need more information before I accept.
I must refuse.

Dialogue.NPCText: "You are wise to ask. I will not have this reliquary fall into just any paws. The recipient is marked by their unique trait: the Skeletal Cat Scholar. Seek out one so attuned—if you have the wit to recognize them. Their name is not for open lips."

Option.text: Very well, I accept the task.
I don’t traffic in secrets.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Cautious. Good. The Skeletal Cat Scholar dwells in exile—rumors place them near the frost-ridden outposts or buried libraries. Approach them openly and you’ll gain nothing; use the phrase, 'Azure storms break silent bones,' and they will trust you."
He smirks. "And yes, the phylactery is warded. Do not open it—unless you wish to join the city's exiles in the Fractured Isle."

Option.text: Understood. Give me the phylactery.
Tell me more about this scholar.
This is too risky.

Dialogue.NPCText: "They once served as a historian in Moonglow—before exile for 'unorthodox' pursuits. Some say they commune with the dead; others say they catalog the end of worlds. Judge them not by appearance, but by intellect. If you return, perhaps I’ll share why I keep such company."

Option.text: I’ll take the risk. Give me the phylactery.
On second thought, no.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Corvus sneers.

"Words like 'necromancer' are for cowards. I deal in results, not superstitions. This phylactery contains knowledge that could turn the tide against Minax—or doom us, if left unused. Will you help, or do you fear a little darkness beneath the light?"

Option.text: I’ll deliver your phylactery.
I’ll have no part in this.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Corvus’s lips curl in a thin, humorless smile.

"Let Selara Vael waste her days in cautious silence. She lacks the will to act, and that will be her undoing. If you fear reprisal, remember—history favors the bold. Aerilon must not fall to indecision."

Option.text: I’m ready. Give me the phylactery.
I’ll have to refuse.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Corvus presses the cold reliquary into your palm. The runes flicker, almost alive.

"Deliver this to the one with the Skeletal Cat Scholar trait. Say the phrase: 'Azure storms break silent bones.' Return when the deed is done, and Aerilon will remember your loyalty."
He leans close.
"And remember—trust no one. Especially not the Archivist."

Option.text: I will deliver it discreetly.
Wait, you warned me about the Archivist—why?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Corvus nods curtly.

"Go now, and do not tarry. The city’s fate may hinge on whispers, not wars."

Option.text: I won’t fail you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Corvus’s expression darkens.

"Eryndil the Archivist listens too closely, speaks too little, and forgets nothing. His allegiances are a web—Selara trusts him, but I do not. Complete this task before word reaches his ears, and your reward will be doubled."

Option.text: Understood. I’ll deliver the phylactery at once.
On second thought, I’m not getting involved.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"I keep Aerilon alive while others bicker over philosophy. War is coming, and I prepare the only defense that matters: overwhelming force."
He gestures to his staff.
"Mages like Veyra are my legacy. She could be great—if she would stop second-guessing herself."

Option.text: Tell me more about Veyra.
So you favor action over debate?
I’d like to serve Aerilon. Any tasks?
I’m done here.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Veyra is young, but fierce. I have pushed her harder than most. Some call it cruelty—I call it necessary. In these times, only the relentless survive."
He scowls.
"Selara would coddle her, but I see the strength within. If you wish to impress me, show loyalty—not to her, but to Aerilon’s future."

Option.text: Understood. Any assignments?
Sounds like you have a rivalry with Selara.
I’ve heard enough.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Debate is the graveyard of empires. If Aerilon hesitates, Minax will devour us all. I intend to act before the storm breaks. Will you help, or will you stand idle?"

Option.text: I’ll help.
I will stand aside.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Corvus’s eyes glint coldly.

"Selara Vael is brilliant—some say too brilliant for her own good. She binds Aerilon with rules and secrets, but refuses to grasp the power within reach. We were once allies, now she fears the cost of victory."
He taps his staff.
"History will judge which of us is right. Until then, I act in Aerilon’s interest. And you—what side will you take?"

Option.text: I’m with you. Aerilon’s strength comes first.
Selara has her reasons. I stand neutral.
I’d rather not choose sides.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Neutrality is a luxury for those who don’t fear consequences. Remember that when the city trembles."

Option.text: I’ll consider my choices.
Perhaps I can help Aerilon after all.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Corvus’s expression turns briefly grim.

"I sense betrayal in the air. Minax’s agents prowl, Selara's spies whisper, and even the crystals tremble with unrest. Trust is a blade to be handled carefully. If you wish to help, take this delivery—prove yourself, and perhaps I’ll trust you more than the rest."

Option.text: Give me the task.
What do you mean, the crystals tremble?
Not my concern.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Sabotage, perhaps. Or simple wear. Salia Moontide frets over their stability, but I suspect more than faulty craftsmanship. If the crystals fail, Aerilon will fall—literally and politically."

Option.text: That sounds urgent. I’ll help with your task.
Let Salia handle it. I’m done here.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Corvus arches a brow, caught off guard by your curiosity.

"Hmph. Few care for the past anymore—too busy scuttling through the present like rats avoiding floodwater."
He folds his hands behind his back, voice lowering.
"Very well. I was born in Wind, among towers and tomes. Son of Archivist Deyne—yes, *that* Deyne, from the Circle of Forty Scrolls. My mother died birthing me; my father raised me as a living thesis. I mastered destruction magic before I could grow a proper beard. But I asked the wrong questions..."

Option.text: What questions got you exiled?
Your father sounds... intense.
So Wind cast you out? Why?
This sounds like trauma masked with pride.
Sounds rough. Want a drink?

Dialogue.NPCText:
He freezes for a beat, then laughs darkly.

"You're sharper than most crystal diviners. Yes—perhaps there’s pain beneath the armor. But pain forged purpose. The question is: will *you* wield pain as blade or chain?"

Option.text: Maybe I can learn from your example.
Pain isn't always power.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Corvus scoffs.

"And flowers bloom in ash? I deal in truths, not sentiment. But… I won’t mock you for hope. Hope is the last spell we cast before silence."

Option.text: Let’s get back to your story.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Corvus blinks, then chuckles under his breath.

"You jest, and yet... a sip of Frostbrew might do more for diplomacy than all our spells. Perhaps after you’ve earned your keep, groundling."

Option.text: Deal. Continue your tale.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"I asked why the Conclave hoarded knowledge, why forbidden magic was ‘forbidden’—who decided what truths the people deserved."
He sighs.
"They said I grew arrogant. I said they grew stagnant. They exiled me the next day and sealed the vault I’d nearly unlocked."

Option.text: What was in that vault?
You’ve carried that fire ever since.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Corvus narrows his eyes.

"I never saw beyond its second seal, but I heard it whisper. Ancient Aeon runes, a spell schema shaped like a sigil of Minax—but older."
He touches his staff.
"It changed me. Made me aware of how deep the Well of Power truly is. And how shallow Wind truly is."

Option.text: Do you believe Minax seeks that same power?
You fear Wind’s stagnation more than Minax?

Dialogue.NPCText: "Minax desires the Gem. She wishes to *control* fate. I… seek to *understand* it. That is the difference between tyranny and transcendence."

Option.text: Let’s return to your tale.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Yes. Minax is an enemy. Wind is a rot that spreads beneath marble halls. One can fight evil with strength—but stagnation… it lulls you into chains."

Option.text: You’re no stranger to sharp truths.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"He measured love in lessons and affection in footnotes. Cold? Yes. But without him, I’d be some hedge wizard mumbling fireballs in Trinsic taverns."
He almost smiles.
"I do not miss him, yet I carry his ghost in every spell I cast."

Option.text: You became more than he ever intended.
What would he say of you now?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Corvus gazes skyward.

"He’d say I lost discipline and let emotion guide me. He’d be wrong, of course. Emotion *drives* discipline. Passion *fuels* progress. That, he never understood."

Option.text: You’ve forged your own truth.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"I wasn’t *cast* out. I walked. They held a trial—I laughed through it. Said my ambition made me unfit for Wind. So I found another wind... one that lifted cities."
He gestures to the horizon.
"Aerilon rose from defiance. And I carved the first rune of the spell that keeps it afloat."

Option.text: You helped build Aerilon?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Enough of memory. The past informs, but the present demands. You’ve seen my truth, stranger. I do not fear the dark, and I will not bow to those who wrap chains in banners."

He leans closer.
"I ask again—will you stand with me when the storm breaks, or hide beneath Selara’s skirts?"

Option.text: You have my loyalty. I seek strength.
I respect you, but I won’t follow blindly.
I prefer my own path.

Dialogue.NPCText: "A fair stance. Just don’t let independence become isolation. When Minax strikes, the sky won’t care who you answered to."

Option.text: Then I’d best make myself useful.
Farewell, Archmage.
